paragraphs.text: Marathons don't cut it any more - the extreme events offer the best rush.
paragraphs.label: title

paragraphs.text: I'm not sure when the abnormal became normal
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I remember a time not so long ago when a marathon runner was a mythical beast
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: we all knew someone who knew someone who had run a marathon
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: most of us had only ever seen these creatures on the TV in their emaciated, long-limbed flow
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: now everyone knows a marathon runner
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: they just look like normal people
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Somewhere along the way, marathons became commonplace
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a whole new breed of extreme activities came along- the Ironman triathlon; multi-day cycle events like John O'Groats to Lands End; crazy ultra marathons like the Thames Path 100; and events that defy description like the Tough Mudder.
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: While
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: a lot of extreme challenges are to do with ultra endurance
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: the Tough Mudder is short but involves getting hurt. Sometimes by electric shocks. And fire
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What is wrong with you, Mudders?
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: I have no idea what caused the rise of the extreme sports as a phenomenon
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I do know what happened for me
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: After many years of corporate life and general indolence I found myself resting a glass of champagne on a large belly, unable to get to the buffet without puffing
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Horrified at the realisation that I had become Mr Creosote from The Meaning of Life, I resolved immediately to sign up for the Great Edinburgh Run
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The GER was only 10k
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: but
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: it terrified me and filled me with doubts
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: what if I came last?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Do I have to run all the way?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Will I be the fattest dude on the course?
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Four months later I completed it easily
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And then I signed up for a marathon
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And then an Ironman
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: And this is the thing - every step of the way you reassess your judgment of what is crazy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It becomes a rapidly escalating obsession
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: What seemed like a hardcore event reserved solely for proper endurance loons soon becomes just within reach
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Six years after the GER, the only event I still consider to be bonkers beyond belief is the Marathon des Sables
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: And that's only because everyone knows that Scots melt in the desert
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: My personal theory for the rise of the extreme sports is that life has become sterile
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: The chances of really getting an adrenaline rush in day-to-day life is minimal
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: so
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: people search out ways to re-engage with life
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: After completing two Ironman events, I can testify that the feeling of sweeping down the finish chute after 140.6 miles to pumping pop music, flashing lights and a cheering crowd is the ultimate buzz
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: But
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: finishing a marathon, in an empty car park, in the dark, in the pouring rain, is easily its equal for an overwhelming inner sense of achievement
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The other personal joy I get from training for events is the quiet time
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Although modern life is humdrum
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: it is noisy
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: even a three-mile run gives me the chance to clear my head, breathe cold fresh air and feel the wind on my skin
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: Within 10 minutes of beginning a run my head is clear
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: I am calm
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: and
paragraphs.label: no-unit

paragraphs.text: I am reset
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The side benefit of all this training (and probably the reason that most people start) is health
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: If you run, cycle or swim you lose weight and feel more vital for it
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You are fitter, stronger and sleep more soundly
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You are fit for life - the kid climbing on your shoulders, the run for the bus
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: even just climbing the stairs become infinitely more manageable
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: It also sets a great example
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: my three-year-old has now collected finisher's medals at Ironkids and Loch Ness Marathon and loves being outside
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: because that's what mummy and daddy do
paragraphs.label: anecdote

paragraphs.text: The increase in demand cannot be satisfied
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: A new event seems to spring up every day
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: No longer restricted by a single Ironman distance you can do double, triple or even (for the proper enthusiasts) deca Ironman
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You can run the 268 frostbitten, British-winter miles of the Spine Race
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: You can even get teargassed in the Tough Mudder
paragraphs.label: assumption

paragraphs.text: Whether for the T-shirt, the tattoo or just the sheer pride of accomplishment, extreme sports are here to stay
paragraphs.label: assumption
